creator: alex@finix.de
text:
It seems to be impossible to parameterize non String Properties of TestElements
with user-defined variables.

e.g. It is possible to parameterize the target host with ${host}, but the same
pattern does not work, with ${port} in HTTPSamples.


asac
*** Bug 16209 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
jsalvata@atg.com
text:
I've tried to reproduce this by creating a test plan with two GET requests for
http://localhost, one with port ${p1} and one with port ${p2}. p1 is defined as
80 in the Test Plan. p2 is defined as 81. A View Results Tree listener shows
that the p1 request succeeds, the p2 one fails with a Connection refused
exception. The Request Data shows the correct port in both cases.

This works the same in the current nightlies and in 1.8.

Before I close this as WORKSFORME, can you please provide a more specific
example of the case that didn't work for you?

Yes, there is some places where you can't use ${vars} (although the one reported
here doesn't seem to be one). This is annoying, but doesn't prevent testing.
Setting severity to Normal, priority to Medium.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
I think I understand this: the .toString() of an HttpRequest is confusing, as it
shows the numerical port instead of whatever you actually entered.

Doesn't look like this actually affects users (only confuses developers). I
agree confusing developers is a Very Bad Thing, but I'll still reduce severity
to Minor and Priority to Low -- unfortunately, we have Even Worse Things to
worry about. Feel free to change it back to whatever you feel like if you don't
agree.

creator: alex@finix.de
text:
The current CVS HEAD lets this problem revive. Now there seems to be no way to
configure a HTTP Sample Port as a variable, e.g. ${port}. When starting I get a
NumberFormatException in Test compilation.

If you cannot reproduce it and need a testcase, or need some more information,
let me know!!

For it prevents me from testing I switch the priority to medium severity to normal.

I fixed this for the ThreadGroup gui and for the timers.  If there are others,
please open new bugs that specify the components that cause the problem.
